org.jcp.jsr94.tck
Class HandleTest

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--junit.framework.Assert
        |
        +--junit.framework.TestCase
              |
              +--org.jcp.jsr94.tck.HandleTest
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class HandleTest
extends junit.framework.TestCase

Tests the compliance of Handle implementation classes. This class performs the following test scenario:

  • An object is added to a stateful rule session and a handle is obtained. That object has defined properly the equals and hashCode methods.
  • The obtained handle must be an instance of Handle.
  • The rule session then must contain the handle.
  • The object returned by StatefulRuleSession.getObject(Handle) must be equals to the initial object.
  • The object is changed to be another object of the same class.
  • The rule session is updated with the handle containing the new object.
  • The rule session must again contain the handle.
  • The object returned by StatefulRuleSession.getObject(Handle) must be equals to this new object.
  • The handle is removed from the rule session.
  • The rule session must not contain the handle.
Note:
This test uses a RuleSetExecution definition that is stored in the tck_res_2.xml. You have to change this file accoding to your rule execution set definition. The mainline TCK documentation describes the contents of this rule execution set definition.

Since:
JSR-94 1.0
Version:
1.0
